requiredMoves.description: While in an armed conflict your Open Fire roll, if it is a hit, is +1 Hold.

optionalMoves.description: When you Perform a Scan against a ship, on a hit, you automatically get a free question: “What is the weakest part or system on this ship?”
When a member of your away team is attacked, roll +Duty. On a 10+, choose 2. On a 7-9, choose 1. On a 6-, you both suffer the original attack.
holds: You redirect the attack to yourself.
You get into advantageous position against the attacker, take Advantage Forward for your next move against them.

optionalMoves.description: When performing an Open Fire move with a handheld weapon, inflict +1 Harm and take -1 Harm, but you may not keep yourself out of harm’s way.
When you Open Fire, you always at least Hold 1, even on a miss.
You have a specially trained security squad that counts as your own squad (see AW’s mob rules).
When you Issue Orders in a combat situation, roll +War instead of +Rank.
When you Open Fire, you may take Disadvantage to fire multiple weapon systems at once.
May only be taken as an advancement. You are +1 Rank (maximum +3).

descriptors.name: Warrior
descriptors.advancement: If you found yourself in a situation that meant indeed, today is a good day to die, mark experience.

descriptors.name: Logical
descriptors.advancement: If you explored an alternative to violence in a violent situation, mark experience.

descriptors.name: Down-Homey
descriptors.advancement: If you entered into a conflict so strange that it defied all of your experiences, mark experience.

descriptors.name: Augmented
descriptors.advancement: If your superior abilities in battle caused you to become alienated from others, mark experience.

descriptors.name: Outsider
descriptors.advancement: If your reaction to a battle was handled in a completely alien way, mark experience.

	-Lt. Worf
roleFluff:
The tactical officer, tactics officer or tactical aide was an officer stationed at the tactical station and was responsible controlling a starship's weaponry and shields.... (TNG: "Redemption"; Star Trek III: The Search for Spock)

On Starfleet vessels, the tactical officers job was to maintain weapon and shield readiness along with executing firing solutions. These solutions could range from a low intensity phaser beam or to plot a torpedo firing pattern. Security chiefs frequently doubled as tactical officers, though the two roles were not required to be filled by the same person. (TNG: "Pen Pals", "Masks")
	-Memory Alpha Wiki
